channel.title: [Tutorial] Runescape Bmps!
channel.description:
This will help you make a tutorial on how to make a Runescape Bitmap!
[b]Info[/b] Sorry for the big pics. To un-named Next time you have a problem post it dont lock it, ill modify it.(besides the fact that the pics are to big)
People are learning to know what bitmaps are, theres a bitmaps tutorial out there (Kanes) explaining how to make one. For runescape bitmaps, this is the thread.
Bitmaps-a picture of words,pictures or of letters.
Lets get started,Open up scar(link below) and a runescape world and place.
When you find a picture you want to take, on your keyboard there should be a hotkey called printscar__Sys Rq. Press that hotkey log out of runescape(or x out) and go to MS Paint. Either go to edit and paste it or press Ctrl+V. Use the picture takeouter thing at the top left(the box one).And cut around the picture you want to put into your scar script.
Note*For words you cut out the spaces between in and around it.(black words dont work)
When your done with all the save it and give it a name, then X out.
On SCAR click Script and and click picture to string.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img501.imageshack.us/img501/563/linkpic1bmptutmj6.jpg[/img][/URL]
A window should open up,on the window click open.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img501.imageshack.us/img501/2775/linkpic2bmptutgx6.jpg[/img][/URL]
Open up the picture you made in MS Paint(Runescape). The window should come back up and the picture will be there. Now click OK.
Look at the Debug Box (bottom box) and letters with numbers will show up.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img523.imageshack.us/img523/4766/linkpic4bmptutec0.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img108.imageshack.us/img108/4449/linkpic3bmptutdc5.jpg[/img][/URL]
Now copy(CTRL+C) and Paste(Ctrl+V) into your script under program
Congrats !!!!! Youve put a RS bitmap into your script and ready to use!
To use it as a procedure, if(findbitmap('BitmapName',x,y)Then BlaBlaBla
Which should look like this. [code] if(findbitmap('BitmapName',x,y)Then [/code]
There are others like [code] function FindBitmapsProgressiveTol(bmp1, bmp2, bmp3, bmp4, bmp5, tolmax, step, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; By: Stupid3000 Description: Finds any of maximum 5 bitmaps in box specified by xs,ys,xe,ye. If you only need to find one bitmap, fill in 0 for others.
function FindBitMapTol(var TX, TY: Integer; BitMap, x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer): Boolean; By: WT-Fakawi Description: Finds Bitmap in box x1,y1,x2,y2. Returns Coords of found Bitmap.
function FindBitMapTolRaiser(BitMap, x, y, StartingTol, EndingTol, p1, p2, p3, p4: Integer): Boolean; By: Sdcit Description: Finds Bitmap in box p1,p2,p3,p4. Returns Coords of found Bitmap. Raises Tol according to StartingTol and EndingTol.
function FindDeformed(var Xoff, Yoff: Integer; BMP, a, b, c, d: Integer): Boolean; By: WT-Fakawi Description: Finds Bitmap in Box a,b,c,d. Returns coords in ObjX and ObjY. Uses Deformed Bitmap. FindDeformed will gradually lower Tol and reduce Accuracy. Functon can cause severe Lag when using bitmaps bigger then 16 pixels. Works but Lags. Useful for MM-clicking. For ObjectFinding use FindObjectDeformed. [/code] [size=3pt](i dont understand, i suck at SCAR)[/size]
And Also What every your bitmaps name is, You need a Var for it!
Under program put Var(Variable) Like this [code] Program something;
Var [/code]
Then put
BitmapsNameHere :integer;
[code] Program something;
var BitmapsNameHere :integer; [/code]
What i mean by BitmapsNameHere is to put your bitmaps name there.
Congratz!!!! Now your really finished!

item.title: [Tutorial] Runescape Bmps!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“junkj, post:3, topic:77350”]Well i could make the pics smaller.
And you locked the thread because to prevent spam from happening?[/quote]

Spam or flame. Please, do make the pictures smaller. I personally won’t put any tutorial done in a rush through to the tutorial and FAQ section.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tutorial] Runescape Bmps!
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

This will help you make a tutorial on how to make a Runescape Bitmap!

Info
Sorry for the big pics.
To un-named
Next time you have a problem post it dont lock it, ill modify it.(besides the fact that the pics are to big)

People are learning to know what bitmaps are, theres a bitmaps tutorial out there (Kanes)
explaining how to make one.
For runescape bitmaps, this is the thread.

Bitmaps-a picture of words,pictures or of letters.

Lets get started,Open up scar(link below) and a runescape world and place.

When you find a picture you want to take, on your keyboard there should be a hotkey called printscar__Sys Rq.
Press that hotkey log out of runescape(or x out) and go to MS Paint.
Either go to edit and paste it or press Ctrl+V.
Use the picture takeouter thing at the top left(the box one).And cut around the picture you want to put into your
scar script.

Note*For words you cut out the spaces between in and around it.(black words dont work)

When your done with all the save it and give it a name, then X out.

On SCAR click Script and and click picture to string.

A window should open up,on the window click open.

Open up the picture you made in MS Paint(Runescape).
The window should come back up and the picture will be there. Now click OK.

Look at the Debug Box (bottom box) and letters with numbers will show up.

Now copy(CTRL+C) and Paste(Ctrl+V) into your script under program

Congrats !!! Youve put a RS bitmap into your script and ready to use!

To use it as a procedure, if(findbitmap(‘BitmapName’,x,y)Then
BlaBlaBla

Which should look like this.

if(findbitmap('BitmapName',x,y)Then

There are others like

function FindBitmapsProgressiveTol(bmp1, bmp2, bmp3, bmp4, bmp5, tolmax, step, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; 
By: Stupid3000 
Description:
     Finds any of maximum 5 bitmaps in box specified by xs,ys,xe,ye.
     If you only need to find one bitmap, fill in 0 for others.

function FindBitMapTol(var  TX, TY: Integer; BitMap, x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer): Boolean; 
By: WT-Fakawi 
Description:
     Finds Bitmap in box x1,y1,x2,y2. Returns Coords of found Bitmap.

function FindBitMapTolRaiser(BitMap, x, y, StartingTol, EndingTol, p1, p2, p3, p4: Integer): Boolean; 
By: Sdcit 
Description:
     Finds Bitmap in box p1,p2,p3,p4. Returns Coords of found Bitmap. Raises Tol
     according to StartingTol and EndingTol.

function FindDeformed(var  Xoff, Yoff: Integer; BMP, a, b, c, d: Integer): Boolean; 
By: WT-Fakawi 
Description:
     Finds Bitmap in Box a,b,c,d. Returns coords in ObjX and ObjY.
     Uses Deformed Bitmap. FindDeformed will gradually lower Tol and reduce Accuracy.
     Functon can cause severe Lag when using bitmaps bigger then 16 pixels. Works but Lags.
     Useful for MM-clicking. For ObjectFinding use FindObjectDeformed.

[size=3pt](i dont understand, i suck at SCAR)[/size]

And Also What every your bitmaps name is,
You need a Var for it!

Under program put Var(Variable)
Like this

Program something;

Var

Then put

BitmapsNameHere :integer;

Program something;

var
BitmapsNameHere :integer;

What i mean by BitmapsNameHere is to put your bitmaps name there.

Congratz!!! Now your really finished!

Read full topic
